meanings.definition: To act in a secretive or silent manner.
meanings.sent1: She mummed her way through the dark forest, trying not to make a sound.
meanings.sent2: The spy mummed his movements to avoid detection by the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The ninja mummed her steps, sneaking up on the unsuspecting guard.
meanings.sent4: The quiet cat mummed its way closer to the bird feeder.
meanings.sent5: He mummed his surprise party plans to keep them a secret.

meanings.definition: To cover up or keep quiet about something.
meanings.sent1: She mummed the mistake she made in the report, hoping no one would notice.
meanings.sent2: The politician mummed the scandal to avoid negative publicity.
meanings.sent3: The kids mummed their broken vase incident from their parents.
meanings.sent4: The company mummed the financial losses to maintain a positive image.
meanings.sent5: He mummed his fear of spiders, pretending to be brave.

meanings.definition: To pretend to be ill or silent.
meanings.sent1: The student mummed being sick to skip the test.
meanings.sent2: She mummed a sore throat to avoid speaking in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The puppy mummed a limp to get extra attention from its owner.
meanings.sent4: He mummed a headache to stay home and play video games.
meanings.sent5: The actor mummed a cough to add realism to the scene.
